message.content:
cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.SD, cs.DC, cs.PL

Reasoning: The paper describes a framework and toolkit for interactive graphics, which is likely to fall under the computer graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. The focus on user interface and visualisation primitives suggests a potential fit for the human-computer interaction (cs.HC) sub-category. The use of the framework for physics experiments and detector design may also make it relevant to the software engineering (cs.SE) and distributed, parallel, and cluster computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. Finally, the integration with control panels and command line interfaces may suggest a connection to programming languages (cs.PL).
